items.question: Is it legal to ask patients for reviews?
items.answer: Yes, asking patients for reviews is completely legal and encouraged by platforms like Google. items.question: What's review gating and is it allowed?
items.answer: Review gating means filtering unhappy patients away from public review sites. Google prohibited explicit gating in 2018, but invitation-based review requests (where you invite all patients to review, not just happy ones) remain fully compliant. PracticeDilly sends requests to all patients equally—the 'smart routing' happens only after they voluntarily provide feedback. This is compliant with current Google guidelines while still giving unhappy patients a private channel to share concerns.

whyChoose.description: Patients live on their smartphones—checking apps 96 times daily on average. A branded mobile app puts your practice on their home screen, just a tap away. Not a mobile website they'll never bookmark. Not a patient portal they'll forget exists. A real app, with your branding, offering the convenient experience modern patients expect. PracticeDilly makes practice apps accessible to practices of all sizes.

items.title: Your Brand on Every Patient's Home Screen
items.description: When patients download your app, your logo appears on their phone next to Netflix, Instagram, and their bank. That's premium real estate for patient engagement. Every time they scroll past, they're reminded of your practice. Push notifications cut through inbox clutter with 90%+ open rates. It's the most direct communication channel possible—and it's branded entirely to your practice, not to a third-party portal.

items.title: Self-Service Features Patients Actually Want
items.description: Today's patients don't want to call for everything. Your app lets them book and manage appointments, send secure messages to your team, pay bills and view statements, complete intake forms, and access treatment information—all without picking up a phone. Self-service isn't just convenient for patients; it reduces your front desk workload and frees staff for higher-value tasks.

items.title: Push Notifications That Patients Don't Ignore
items.description: Email has 20% open rates. Text is better at 98%. But push notifications? They appear on lock screens instantly and get 90%+ engagement. Use push for appointment reminders, appointment availability alerts, balance due notices, and recall reminders. Patients who download your app are your most engaged segment—push notifications keep them active and booking.

items.title: Real App Store Presence, No Development Team Required
items.description: PracticeDilly publishes your app in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store under your practice's name. Patients search, find, and download your branded app just like any other. You don't need developers, designers, or app store accounts. We handle the technical side while you focus on patient care. Updates and new features roll out automatically.

faq.description: Common questions about PracticeDilly's patient mobile app

items.question: Is the app listed in the App Store and Google Play under our practice's name?
items.answer: Yes! Your app is published in both the Apple App Store and Google Play Store under your practice's name and branding. Patients search for your practice name and download your app just like any other. It's a fully native app experience, not a mobile website or white-labeled generic app. We handle all the app store submission and approval processes.

items.question: How long does it take to get our app live in the stores?
items.answer: Typically 4-6 weeks from kickoff to live in stores. This includes branding customization (2 weeks), development and testing (2 weeks), and app store review/approval (1-2 weeks). Apple's review process can sometimes add time, but we manage the entire submission process. Most practices are live within 6 weeks.

items.question: What features are included in the patient app?
items.answer: Standard features include appointment booking and management, secure messaging with your team, mobile payments and billing, digital intake forms, appointment reminders via push notification, treatment information access, and practice contact details. Custom features can be added based on your needs. The app integrates with PracticeDilly's other products for a seamless patient experience.

items.question: How do we get patients to download the app?
items.answer: We provide marketing materials including QR codes for your office, email/text campaigns to existing patients, and website badges. Most practices see 20-40% app adoption within the first year. Push notifications and self-service features drive organic adoption—patients who experience the convenience become advocates. We help you develop an adoption strategy during onboarding.

items.question: Can patients book appointments through the app?
items.answer: Yes! Online scheduling is fully integrated into the app. Patients see real-time availability, choose their provider and appointment type, and book with a few taps. Appointments sync with your practice management system instantly. It's the same powerful scheduling as our web product, optimized for mobile experience.

items.question: Is the app HIPAA compliant for patient messaging?
items.answer: Absolutely. All messaging through the app is HIPAA compliant with end-to-end encryption, secure authentication, and full audit logging. Messages are never sent through standard SMS or email—they stay within the secure app environment. This makes the app ideal for discussing clinical matters, sharing images, and communicating PHI when appropriate.

items.question: What happens when you release new features?
items.answer: New features roll out to your app automatically through our update process. We regularly enhance the app based on patient feedback and healthcare industry trends. Major updates go through app store review (typically 1-3 days) and become available to patients automatically. You don't need to do anything—the app stays current on its own.

items.question: How does the app affect our no-show rates?
items.answer: Practices with patient apps typically see 20-40% reductions in no-shows. Push notifications have higher engagement than text or email reminders. Patients can easily reschedule within the app if they can't make an appointment, reducing last-minute no-shows. The convenience of app-based management makes patients more engaged with their appointments overall.
